Summary: R is a programming language and environment primarily used for statistical computing and data analysis. It provides a wide variety of statistical and graphical techniques and is widely used in data science, statistics, and academia for tasks like data manipulation, visualization, and modeling.

More.Summary: A framework for building interactive web applications in R, particularly for data analysis and visualization.

Libraries.Name: shinydashboard
Libraries.Summary: A library to create dashboards in Shiny with a wide variety of UI components.

Libraries.Name: shinymaterial
Libraries.Summary: A library for creating Shiny apps using Material Design components.

Tools.Name: RStudio

More.Summary: A data visualization package for R that uses the Grammar of Graphics to create complex and customizable visualizations.

Libraries.Name: ggplot2 extensions
Libraries.Summary: Additional libraries extending ggplot2 functionality with more visualizations and custom themes.

Tools.Name: RStudio
Tools.Summary: An IDE for R with built-in support for ggplot2 and other data analysis tools.

More.Summary: A powerful package for data manipulation that simplifies common data transformation tasks like filtering, grouping, and summarizing data.

Tools.Name: RStudio
Tools.Summary: An IDE that provides comprehensive support for working with dplyr for data wrangling.

More.Summary: A package that provides functions for tidying up data, helping to reshape datasets into a consistent format for analysis.

More.Summary: A framework for creating dynamic documents, reports, presentations, and dashboards in R by combining code and narrative.

More.Summary: A package for working with time series data in R, providing a convenient way to manipulate and analyze time-based data.

More.Summary: A package that facilitates the integration of R and C++ code, allowing for improved performance in computationally intensive tasks.

Summary: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language for iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and beyond. It is designed to work alongside Apple's Cocoa and Cocoa Touch frameworks, providing a modern alternative to Objective-C, offering safety, performance, and expressiveness.

More.Summary: The core framework for building graphical user interfaces in iOS applications.

Libraries.Name: SwiftUI
Libraries.Summary: A declarative framework for building user interfaces across all Apple platforms.

Libraries.Name: Alamofire
Libraries.Summary: A widely used HTTP networking library for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

Tools.Name: Xcode
Tools.Summary: Apple's integrated development environment (IDE) for building applications for macOS, iOS, and other Apple platforms.

More.Summary: A framework for managing the model layer in iOS applications, providing object-graph management and persistence.

Libraries.Summary: A mobile database for iOS and macOS, offering a simple alternative to Core Data.

Summary: Kotlin is a modern, statically-typed programming language that runs on the JVM and is fully interoperable with Java. It is concise, expressive, and designed to solve many of the issues found in Java, making it a popular choice for Android development and server-side applications.

More.Summary: A Kotlin framework for building web applications and microservices, providing asynchronous, non-blocking I/O support.

Libraries.Name: Ktor Client
Libraries.Summary: A client library for making HTTP requests with Kotlin, part of the Ktor framework.

Libraries.Name: Ktor Features
Libraries.Summary: A set of additional libraries and tools to extend Ktor, including authentication, sessions, logging, and more.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA
Tools.Summary: The most popular IDE for Kotlin development, offering excellent support for Ktor and other Kotlin frameworks.

More.Summary: A framework for building stand-alone, production-grade applications in Java or Kotlin with minimal configuration.

Libraries.Name: Spring WebFlux
Libraries.Summary: A reactive programming model for building web applications in Kotlin.

Libraries.Name: Spring Data Kotlin
Libraries.Summary: Kotlin-specific extensions for Spring Data, simplifying database interactions with Kotlin.

Tools.Name: Spring Tool Suite
Tools.Summary: A set of IDE tools to streamline the development of Spring-based applications, including Kotlin.

More.Summary: A Kotlin SQL framework that allows building type-safe SQL queries and provides an ORM for working with databases.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA
Tools.Summary: IDE that supports Exposed and offers auto-completion and SQL editing tools for Kotlin developers.

More.Summary: A Kotlin library for serialization and deserialization of objects into various formats such as JSON, ProtoBuf, and CBOR.

Libraries.Summary: A specific module for handling JSON serialization and deserialization in Kotlin.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA
Tools.Summary: A popular Kotlin IDE that integrates with Kotlinx Serialization for handling JSON and other formats.

More.Summary: A Kotlin library for simplifying Android development by providing easy-to-use DSLs for layouts, intents, and more.

Tools.Name: Android Studio
Tools.Summary: The official IDE for Android development with full support for Kotlin and Anko.

More.Summary: A domain-specific language (DSL) framework for building readable, concise configuration files in Kotlin.

Libraries.Name: Kotlin Build DSL
Libraries.Summary: A Kotlin-based DSL for building Gradle build scripts.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA

More.Summary: A library for functional programming in Kotlin, offering data types and abstractions for working with immutable data and functional operations.

Libraries.Name: Arrow Fx
Libraries.Summary: A library for building asynchronous, concurrent, and reactive code using functional programming techniques.

Libraries.Name: Arrow Optics
Libraries.Summary: A library for working with immutable data using optics like lenses and prisms.

Tools.Summary: The best IDE for Kotlin with support for functional programming libraries like Arrow.

More.Summary: A testing framework for Kotlin designed to be expressive, lightweight, and easy to use for unit and integration testing.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA

More.Summary: A Kotlin library that simplifies asynchronous programming by providing lightweight threads and cooperative multitasking.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA

More.Summary: A Kotlin-based declarative UI framework for building desktop applications using the same principles as Jetpack Compose for Android.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA

More.Summary: Kotlin Native enables you to compile Kotlin code to native binaries that run without a virtual machine, allowing you to write apps for iOS, embedded systems, and other platforms.

Libraries.Name: Kotlin Multiplatform
Libraries.Summary: A feature of Kotlin Native that allows sharing code across multiple platforms (Android, iOS, JVM, etc.).

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA
Tools.Summary: IntelliJ IDEA has built-in support for Kotlin Native, providing an IDE with advanced features for building cross-platform applications.

More.Summary: A Kotlin API for generating .kt source files, commonly used for code generation tasks.

Tools.Name: IntelliJ IDEA
Tools.Summary: IDE that integrates well with KotlinPoet, providing code generation features and quick access to generated files.

Summary: C++ is a powerful, high-performance programming language widely used in systems software, game development, and applications requiring high-performance graphics and computation. It is a statically-typed language with support for object-oriented, procedural, and generic programming paradigms.

More.Summary: Qt is a cross-platform framework used for developing GUI applications, as well as non-GUI programs like command-line tools and server-side applications.

Libraries.Name: Qt Core
Libraries.Summary: Provides core functionalities like data structures, file handling, and time management in C++ applications.

Libraries.Name: Qt Widgets
Libraries.Summary: A set of UI elements that allows developers to create desktop applications with rich graphical user interfaces.

Tools.Name: Qt Creator
Tools.Summary: A powerful IDE for developing Qt applications, providing advanced code completion, debugging, and integrated tools for both C++ and QML development.

More.Summary: Boost is a collection of peer-reviewed, portable C++ source libraries that help with everything from basic utilities to advanced techniques.

Libraries.Name: Boost Asio
Libraries.Summary: A cross-platform C++ library for network and low-level I/O programming.

Libraries.Name: Boost Filesystem
Libraries.Summary: Provides facilities for performing operations on file systems and their components, such as paths, regular files, and directories.

Tools.Name: CLion
Tools.Summary: A C++ IDE that provides comprehensive support for CMake, Boost libraries, and easy debugging tools.

More.Summary: Eigen is a C++ template library for linear algebra, including matrices, vectors, numerical solvers, and vector operations, widely used in machine learning, robotics, and scientific computing.

Libraries.Name: Eigen Core
Libraries.Summary: Provides matrix and vector operations and algorithms.

Tools.Name: CLion
Tools.Summary: A C++ IDE that supports Eigen and provides code suggestions, debugging, and integration tools.

More.Summary: The STL is a collection of template classes and functions in C++ that provides data structures like vectors, lists, queues, and algorithms for sorting and searching.

Libraries.Name: STL Containers
Libraries.Summary: Provides container classes like vector, map, and set to store and manipulate data efficiently.

Libraries.Name: STL Algorithms
Libraries.Summary: A collection of algorithms like sort, find, and transform that can operate on STL containers.

Tools.Name: Visual Studio
Tools.Summary: A popular IDE for C++ development that provides extensive debugging tools, support for STL, and integration with CMake.

More.Summary: OpenCV is an open-source computer vision and machine learning software library that provides tools for real-time image and video processing.

Libraries.Name: OpenCV Core
Libraries.Summary: Provides low-level data structures and functions for image and video processing, as well as matrix operations.

Libraries.Name: OpenCV Imgproc
Libraries.Summary: Contains a wide variety of functions for image processing, including filters, color space conversions, and edge detection.

Tools.Name: CLion
Tools.Summary: A C++ IDE by JetBrains with support for OpenCV development, debugging, and advanced code assistance.

Summary: C# is a modern, object-oriented, and type-safe programming language developed by Microsoft. It is widely used for developing Windows applications, web applications, and cross-platform mobile apps using .NET Core and Xamarin. C# combines the power of C++ with the simplicity of languages like Java, making it a great choice for both enterprise and game development.

More.Summary: ASP.NET is a framework for building dynamic web applications and services with C#. It provides tools and libraries for web development, including MVC architecture, Web API, and real-time communication using SignalR.

Libraries.Name: ASP.NET Core
Libraries.Summary: A cross-platform framework for building modern web applications and APIs. ASP.NET Core offers better performance and scalability over traditional ASP.NET.

Libraries.Name: SignalR
Libraries.Summary: A library for adding real-time web functionality to applications, allowing server-side code to push content to clients instantly.

Tools.Name: Visual Studio
Tools.Summary: A powerful IDE for C# development with tools for building web applications using ASP.NET, debugging, and managing dependencies.

More.Summary: Xamarin is a cross-platform framework for building mobile applications for Android, iOS, and Windows using C# and .NET. It allows sharing code across platforms while providing native performance.

Libraries.Name: Xamarin.Forms
Libraries.Summary: A UI toolkit for building cross-platform mobile applications with a single codebase, leveraging native controls for a seamless user experience.

Tools.Name: Visual Studio
Tools.Summary: An integrated development environment for building mobile applications with Xamarin, featuring rich debugging and emulator tools.

More.Summary: Entity Framework (EF) is an object-relational mapping (ORM) framework for .NET that allows developers to work with databases using .NET objects, eliminating the need for most of the data-access code.

Libraries.Name: EF Core
Libraries.Summary: A lightweight, cross-platform version of Entity Framework that works with .NET Core to enable developers to use databases with modern applications.

Tools.Name: Visual Studio
Tools.Summary: The primary IDE for .NET development, supporting Entity Framework for managing database models, migrations, and queries.

More.Summary: Unity is a powerful game development platform that uses C# as its primary scripting language. It is widely used for developing both 2D and 3D games and interactive experiences across multiple platforms.

Libraries.Name: Unity Engine
Libraries.Summary: The core framework of Unity, which provides tools for game development, physics, rendering, and more.

Tools.Name: Unity Editor
Tools.Summary: An integrated development environment for creating, testing, and deploying games and interactive applications using Unity.

More.Summary: Blazor is a framework for building interactive web applications using C# instead of JavaScript. It runs in the browser via WebAssembly or on the server.

Libraries.Name: Blazor WebAssembly
Libraries.Summary: Enables client-side web applications to be written in C# using WebAssembly, bringing .NET to the browser.

Libraries.Name: Blazor Server
Libraries.Summary: A server-side model where components run on the server and communicate with the client through a real-time SignalR connection.

Tools.Name: Visual Studio
Tools.Summary: A development environment that includes templates, debugging tools, and support for building Blazor applications.
